data.title: St Albans Cathedral
data.meta_description: St Albans Cathedral, Shrine to Britain's first saint, is the oldest site of continuous Christian worship in Britain. It is a place of worship, music, learning, heritage and events.
data.text:
1381: The Peasants Revolt

Explore St Albans' role in the 1381 Peasants' Revolt with our interactive, research-driven exhibition. Read more

Musical Beasts

Three live interactive performances featuring musicians drawn from the UK’s top orchestras. With Peter and the Wolf with live music and The Bear and the Piano with animated film. Read more

Four Weddings and a Funeral

Experience the British classic Four Weddings and a Funeral at St Albans Cathedral on Wednesday 30 October. Enjoy a special Q&A with director Mike Newell as part of The Alban Film Week! Read more

Grease Sing-A-Long

The sing-a-long screening of the classic film Grease starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John at St Albans Cathedral on Friday 1 November. Read more

Frank’s Big Toe

Dean Jo welcomes Frank Wainwright to the Cathedral. Read more

Abbey Primary School's Memorable End of Year Eucharist

The Abbey Primary School community gathered for a heartfelt end-of-year Eucharist at the Cathedral. Read more

Oliver Morrell to take up new role at Winchester Cathedral

Congratulations Oliver. Read more

Chorister Valedictions 2024

A fond farewell to our six senior choristers Read more
